Find Optimal Cut-off Based on Strength Patterns

Source: R/cutoff_sensitivity_strength.R
find_optimal_cutoff.Rd

Identifies the optimal cut-off value using various criteria based on strength metrics and network structure.

Usage

find_optimal_cutoff(
  mx,
  criterion = "elbow",
  cutoff_range = NULL,
  n_bootstrap = 30,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

mx

Mobility matrix

criterion

Optimization criterion: "elbow", "stability", "balance", "modularity", or "information"

cutoff_range

Range of cut-off values to consider

n_bootstrap

Number of bootstrap samples for stability criterion

verbose

Whether to show progress

Value

List with optimal cut-off and supporting information

Examples

# Generate synthetic mobility data
data <- generate_mobility_data(n_classes = 4, seed = 123)

# Find optimal cut-off using different criteria
optimal_elbow <- find_optimal_cutoff(data, criterion = "elbow", verbose = FALSE)
optimal_balance <- find_optimal_cutoff(data, criterion = "balance", verbose = FALSE)

# Compare results
print(optimal_elbow)
#> Optimal Cut-off Analysis
#> ========================
#> Optimal cut-off value: 1.315 
#> Criterion used: elbow 
#> Explanation: Elbow point: Retains 60.0% of edges while maintaining 71.9% strength concentration 
#> 
#> Metrics at optimal point:
#>   n_edges: 3.000
#>   mean_strength: 2.167
#>   strength_ratio: 0.719
#>   modularity: 0.192
#>   n_components: 1.000
print(optimal_balance)
#> Optimal Cut-off Analysis
#> ========================
#> Optimal cut-off value: 0.261 
#> Criterion used: balance 
#> Explanation: Balanced trade-off: 100.0% edges, 73.6% strength ratio, modularity = 0.000 
#> 
#> Metrics at optimal point:
#>   n_edges: 5.000
#>   mean_strength: 3.044
#>   strength_ratio: 0.736
#>   modularity: 0.000
#>   n_components: 1.000

# Get just the cut-off values
cat("Elbow method suggests:", optimal_elbow$optimal_cutoff, "\n")
#> Elbow method suggests: 1.315355 
cat("Balance method suggests:", optimal_balance$optimal_cutoff, "\n")
#> Balance method suggests: 0.2612059
